name: Global south hawkers’ visualisations_Johannesburg
description:
This Interactive animation was created during the Global south hawkers’ visualizations laboratory in August and September 2021 in Johannesburg, South Africa.

During this laboratory, the resident Crila Regina from Bogota wanted to know the streets of Johannesburg from the perspective of popular work to translate the vision of the street vendors into an interactive animation with the help of Johannesburg 11 creative persons showing the face of the economic search. 

The creative ones who participate and collaborate in the creation  and animation of the characters and some features are:

Nkosinathi Nzima

Ana María Baquero

Hector Mgiba

Karabo Ramalhie

Kutlwano Kgomo

Mandlenkosi Skosana

Mummy Khumalo

Nokuthula Gcinilem

SharpLee Mthimkulu

Tafadzwa Johwa

Thabang Zulu

Tshepo Lebese

Global south hawkers’ visualization laboratory is the winner project of the Plataforma Bogotá Residency - Trias Culture: África Artbox Digital, Distrital Incentive Program of the Distrital Arts Institute - Idartes, Alcaldía Mayor de Bogotá and be taken within the ArtBox Digital award framework promoted by TRIAS CULTURE, with the African Digital Innovation Fak’ugesi Festival and the Communication Agency Griot auspices.

This award is proposed as an accelerator for those artists in Africa and America Latina that seek professional development in digital creation yield and contribute to the global south professional web reinforcement, opening new dialogs with the world.
